privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This privacy policy describes how we handle information when you use this website.
privacy.dataUseText: School data displayed is from public KPM sources. We do not collect your personal information unless you choose to store preferences (e.g. language or cookie consent) on your device.
privacy.cookiesText: This site may store local cookies for language preference and cookie consent. You can control these via your browser settings.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.intro: By using this website, you agree to the following terms.
terms.useOfServiceText: This site is provided for informational purposes only. School data is from public sources and may change. Use the information at your discretion.
terms.noWarrantyText: The service is provided "as is". We do not guarantee the accuracy or availability of data.

home.title: Find Schools
home.description: Search KPM schools by name, location, state and PPD.
home.metaDescription: Search KPM schools by name, location, state and PPD.
home.welcomeSubtitle: Open data, open source—community-driven. Find and compare KPM schools by location and stats.
home.searchPlaceholder: Search schools by name, code or address
home.cardMapDesc: Find school locations on the map.
home.cardSearchDesc: Search by state, PPD and type.

map.title: School Map
map.metaDescription: KPM school location map. Find schools near you.
map.hint: Click markers for school info. Use "Near me" for schools within radius.
map.searchPlaceholder: Search school by name, code or address
map.geolocationUnsupported: Geolocation is not supported by your browser.

compare.title: Compare
compare.metaDescription: Compare schools and get personalised recommendations based on your location and your child’s profile.
compare.intro: This page will let parents compare schools and get recommendations tailored to their child’s situation—for example, language ability and location.
compare.example: If your child has basic Mandarin and you live near Puncak Alam, we’ll suggest which schools suit best.
compare.aim: Our aim is to recommend schools and help balance pupil numbers by considering families within 15 km, so enrolment reflects the local area.

facility.title: Facility Upgrades
facility.metaDescription: Statistics on schools that require upgrades due to poor facilities. We call on KPM to release open data for real analytics.
facility.intro: KPM publishes statistics on schools that need facility upgrades (e.g. poor infrastructure) at projekdaif.moe.gov.my. That dashboard is built in Power BI and the underlying data is not publicly available as open data.
facility.disclaimer: We have no access to the raw data. To provide real analytics, maps, and comparisons on facility needs—and to support accountability and better planning—we need KPM to release this dataset as open data (e.g. CSV/API). This page will go live once that data is available.

pageStats.title: Page Statistics
pageStats.metaDescription: Traffic and usage statistics for carisekolah.my (Umami).
pageStats.intro: Traffic and usage for this site are tracked with Umami (self-hosted, privacy-friendly). The dashboard below is embedded from our Umami instance.
pageStats.embedNotConfigured: Page statistics dashboard is not configured yet. Set NEXT_PUBLIC_UMAMI_SHARE_URL to your Umami share URL to embed the dashboard here.

statistics.title: School Statistics
statistics.metaDescription: KPM school statistics, overall school health, and areas for ministry improvement.
statistics.intro: Holistic view of KPM school health, national KPIs, and data-driven areas to improve. This open data helps the ministry see where to act.
statistics.disclaimer: Data here is from public sources and may be incomplete. Some figures rely on assumptions (e.g. PTR thresholds, definitions of "packed"). Use for reference only; verify with official sources before decisions.
statistics.schoolHealthIntro: Share of schools within or above recommended pupil–teacher ratio (PTR).
statistics.kpiIntro: Key numbers versus a common target (e.g. PTR ≤ 20).
statistics.teacherShortfallDesc: To reach PTR ≤ {target} nationally (enrolment ÷ {target} − current teachers).
statistics.equityWorstTypes: School types with highest avg PTR
statistics.improveIntro: Public, open-source data to show where improvement is needed. Not all schools have the same conditions.
statistics.improvePacked: {count} schools are packed (PTR ≥ {threshold}). Consider more teachers or better distribution of enrolment.
statistics.improveStates: Focus on states with highest average PTR and most packed schools.
statistics.improveTypes: Some school types (e.g. certain vernacular or rural clusters) have worse ratios—target support there.
statistics.improveShortfall: Closing the national teacher shortfall would help meet the PTR target across the system.
statistics.ratioCaption: Ratio = enrolment ÷ teachers. Threshold: ≥ {threshold}. Top 30 shown.
statistics.noPackedSchools: No schools exceed the threshold in this dataset.
statistics.schoolsPer10kDesc: By state — reflects school density vs population
statistics.dataNeededPopulation: Population by state (or district) to show schools per capita and resident-to-school ratio.
statistics.dataNeededFacilities: Facility indicators (e.g. building condition, internet, labs, toilets) for a facilities health index.
statistics.comingSoon: Coming soon — supply data to enable

search.showFirst100: Showing first 100. Narrow filters for more specific results.

schoolDetail.meaningfulStatsIntro: How this school compares to others in the same state and nationally.
schoolDetail.ptrInterpretation: Pupil–teacher ratio is enrolment ÷ teachers. It is not the same as class size: a school can have a moderate PTR but very large classes (e.g. 50 pupils per class in Standard 1) if there are few classes per level.
schoolDetail.classSizePlaceholder: To show average students per class (e.g. Standard 1: 50 per class) and rank schools by real classroom density, we need the data below.
schoolDetail.dataNeededEnrolmentByLevel: Enrolment by year/grade (e.g. Standard 1, 2, … 6; Form 1–5) per school.
schoolDetail.dataNeededClassCount: Number of classes by year/grade per school (bilangan kelas per tahun), or total classrooms (bilik darjah).
schoolDetail.dataNeededOrDirect: Alternatively: average class size or students-per-class by level, if KPM publishes it.
schoolDetail.comingWithData: Once provided, we can show students per class by level and highlight high-density schools for KPM attention.
schoolDetail.idealClassSizeIntro: Assuming one teacher per class, estimated average class size = pupil–teacher ratio. Ideal max: 30 pupils per class.
schoolDetail.aboveIdeal: Above ideal — classes likely exceed 30 pupils on average
schoolDetail.minClassesFor30: Min. classes needed for 30 per class
schoolDetail.teacherShortfall: Shortfall: {count} more teachers needed to meet 30-pupil guideline
schoolDetail.meetsGuideline: Current staff can support classes of ≤30 in theory
